title: 20 Seconds Is WAY too long for Pyke To Hold His Resets
body: Like, why does he get so insanely long to hold a RESET? It lasts nearly as long as his entire ultimate's cooldown late game, which makes no sense. His reset shouldn't last more than like 3-5 seconds each, 20 seconds is ridiculous.

Not sure why you'd even bring up the 20 seconds as if there are tons of other champs with ults that hold resets lol.  Even if we include other abilities they generally fully reset or get time off their CD when a condition is met.  A quick look for ult resets/extension gave me this list:

Extensions-
Aatrox's ult is a buff that lasts 10 seconds and is extended 5 seconds up to 10 seconds per takedown

Katarina's ult doesn't reset, but she gets 15s off CDs per takedown

Master Yi's ult is a buff that lasts 7 seconds and is extended 7 seconds per takedown

Vayne's ult is a buff that last 8/10/12 seconds that is extended by 4 seconds, up to the max duration, per takedown within 3 seconds of her damaging them

Resets-
Diana's ult fully resets if she hits someone affected by her Q.

Darius ult resets on kill w/ 20 second reset that becomes a full reset at rank 3

Pyke's ult is the same as Darius's resetwise except it never fully resets

So, ya good one.  Unless I missed someone the only 2 with ults to reset and hold are Pyke and Darius.  As was mentioned earlier Pyke's ult CD doesn't start ticking down til you're done with it.  Darius's CD starts on first cast.

And yet again as was mentioned the 20 seconds feels like the least abusive part of the ult.  Most reset kills are done in quick succession within 5 seconds.  If the ult was too good or the champ was OP you'd go elsewhere.

100% agreed. An ultimate that can be chained, when it's as powerful as Pyke's, shouldn't be able to hold for too long. It should be a strategic decision when to use it. Hold it too long and he can just fling it around whenever someone's low.
If Pyke proves too strong after these changes, I think this would be a fair nerf. Maybe not as low as 3-5 seconds, but 10 seconds seems very fair to both him and his opponents.

Pyke's creator, when this absurd abomination first came out: _"Chasing the possibility of a pentakill on a support is awesome"_

What else can you expect from this company? :D
Just another way for Riot to lower the skill gap and cater to bad players.

You didn't really give a reason as to why it shouldn't be 20 seconds though. You just say "It makes no sense, let's nerf it", and then back it up with, well, nothing. I could care less if Pyke's reset was 1 second, or even a minute long, I just don't think you have an argument at all here.

> [{quoted}](name=Academy Kayn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cgZFyARV,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-07-17T06:54:40.059+0000)

The argument is that it's op.

Alright, then where's the supporting facts? Are we supposed to believe it's OP because they say it's OP? Is this what is actively breaking Pyke as a champion? What about it is overpowered other than the fact that "he can do it"? Is this one mechanic pushing him over the edge as a champion like Akali's 'True Invisibility' was with her? 

Because out of all the things Pyke has, this one is kinda the least offensive.

I have a feeling you're arguing for the sake of arguing. It doesn't take a genius to look at 20 second window to use an ability that is an AoE, shield-ignoring execute and not wonder in what world that was thought to be a good idea.
Within 20 seconds a rotation can happen, objectives can be taken, someone can get caught and the rest of Pyke's team can setup so that he can wipe.
Theoretically speaking, if he maximises his timings, he can keep an effective execute uptime of about 80 seconds providing he gets a kill every 20 seconds after the first. This is the length of some champions entire ultimate cooldowns in which Pyke can use his 5 times.
This wouldn't be an issue if that's all he did but he has so much utility, mobility and other forms of damage that it seems like the cherry on the overloaded cake.

I mean, you're technically not wrong as I started off my comment in this thread with "Where is the argument here". I just think that people should have actual written out coherent arguments instead of 'nerf dis' posts, which does very little for discussion. Hell, look at your first thing, you don't actually list anything but what it is, a "AOE, shield ignoring execute". Well, congrats on listing out what an ability does, now why exactly is it a problem. You're just telling me "I should know it is one", that's not how it works. You're supposed to tell me why, which you do. 

Like said, could hardly care if it's 20, 60, or 3. I just want people to provide an actual argument to why something should be nerfed, cause otherwise it just looks like someone complaining. The boards is already steeped in posts that don't bother to move past their title, I'd rather have discussion here, and people need to actually list out why they see wrong and not depend on others blindly agreeing with them.

It's like you're actively ignoring what the discussion is about.

The point is how an ability with this many pros also has an unnecessarily long reset. No other ability with this many things i.e. Being a reset execute, that ignores shields that also is AoE AND gives extra gold to teammates has the potential to be an active threat for such a long time. 

This is on top of what he already has in his kit:
Passive: AD boost and free health after trade/burst
Q: a hook and two slows and damge
W: movement speed and invis
E: dash, potential multi-hit stun and damage

Lets not ignore he was designed as a support champion for mid players who were autofilled. His kit is good enough to go solo lane and he's been seen in every role viably aside from ADC. 

So maybe reducing the active time he has the ability to wipe a team on top of his playmaking catch potential is a way to reduce his impact overall since that already makes him a really good pick.

And don't tell me all I've done is list what he does here, I've said exactly what the issue is and what could be done about it.

You're still not telling me why it's unnecessarily long. I completely get that you folk think that it's unnecessary on something that has so much going for it, but that doesn't excuse 'he has so much, he's fine without it/with less of it' as a reason to just nerf it. 

Why is it being 20 seconds a problem, and why does it deserve a nerf? 

For example, you list that if you wanted to reduce his impact overall, this would be a good place to nerf. But what if that isn't his problem? Is Pyke overbearing to play against because he might be able to roam to a different lane after killing bot, and secure another? That seems like the actual design around giving him that 20 seconds though, for Pykes to go bloodthirsty and go for the big plays. Maybe too strong? Possibly, but this is where i take issue with when people say "Well he just has this AND that", cause there's typically a reason behind that. 

 You talk about him being good in almost every role, which is why we're currently getting nerfs to get him out of every role, and back into Support ~~Where he belongs and should stay~~. 

I guess at the end of the day, I don't see the point of nerfing something for the point of nerfing something. If it's not problematic, although we both have different views on whether or not it's problematic, then it shouldn't be touched over what's actually making his impact on the game far too great. In my own personal experience, this has not been the issue that's been Pyke's big impact on the game, but that's my own anecdotal evidence. 

This discussion, these arguments, they should be in the OP's post. Because we can disagree on whether or not his ability to hold onto his ult is what makes him too strong and deserves a nerf, and then talk about why we have our opinions. We can discuss whether or not this is Pyke's biggest issue.

But no, all we have is a complaint about Pyke, and someone asking for nerfs, with no argument in tow. Just 'he does X thing, and I don't like it." When I first saw this, I honestly felt like it should've been under rant, because what discussion is there to be had with his points? There aren't any points to discuss. Just 'nerf dis'.

OP? No he isn't. "What do you guys think?" is a question asking for opinions. "It shouldnt be 20, so they should nerf it to 3-5" is not asking for opinions. It's asking for nerfs with no back up or reasons why. His only cases are 'it lasts as long as his ult late game' which is just a comparison, and 'why does it last so long', which is just his own opinion. 

If you want a productive thread that's meant for discussion, you start with "I don't think Pyke's Ult reset should be so long" and then back it up with why it's a problem, and why it should be nerfed. "It should be nerfed because Pyke's mobility and speed allows him to easily roam the map fast enough and possibly pick up a kill midlane", which is what Dudeguy is saying. He makes an actual argument, and a reason for why it should be nerfed. 

OP does not. He can share his opinion, for certain, but Gameplay is not for just stating your frustrations and asking for nerfs. That is for rant. Out of the feedback we've gotten for the updated Gameplay guidelines we're still working on, these kind of posts are not discussion, they're rants.

Because his entire damage and threat budget is in his ult. Youd have to give him far more damage on his kit or a 20s CD level 11 ult to do this

It's to allow him to dip out of the fight for a minute, or travel to another fight if small skirmishes are going on, without wasting the ult entirely. It also doesn't start the cooldown until the reset drops either which is a major factor people overlook: holding an ult on Pyke can actually hinder your future ability to all in especially in early game laning when 20 seconds added to a cooldown is a big deal.
